titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartman
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge Edward J. Garcia on 1/25/2012 ORDERING #55, 56 The court is not unsympathetic to defendant Brett Lee Hartman situation. Nonetheless, the court is not immediately aware of, nor has defendant cited, any authority which allows the court to direct the head of a federal correctional institution in another jurisdiction to satisfy defendant's demands. Rather, defendant must pursue his remedies with the institution administratively, or with the federal district court within the district in which he is incarcerated. (Reader, L)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Senior Judge Edward J. Garcia on 1/25/2012 ORDERING #55, 56 The court is not unsympathetic to defendant Brett Lee Hartman situation. Nonetheless, the court is not immediately aware of, nor has defendant cited, any authority which allows the court to direct the head of a federal correctional institution in another jurisdiction to satisfy defendant's demands. Rather, defendant must pursue his remedies with the institution administratively, or with the federal district court within the district in which he is incarcerated. (Reader, L)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartman
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Craig M. Kellison on 5/15/13 ORDERING that Respondent is directed to file a response to movants motion within 60days from the date of service of this order; Movants traverse or reply (if respondent files an answer to the motion), if any, or opposition or statement of non-opposition (if respondent files a motion in response) shallbe filed and served within 30 days of service of respondents response; and The Clerk of the Court shall serve a copy of this order, together with acopy of movant's motion, on the United States Attorney or his authorized representative. (cc US Atty) (Dillon, M)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Craig M. titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartman
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Craig M. Kellison on 10/21/13 as to Brett Lee Hartman recommending that this action be dismissed without prejudice, for lack of prosecution and failure to comply with court rules and order. Motion pursuant to 28 USC 2255 58 referred to U.S. District Judge William B. Shubb. Objections due within 14 days. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartman
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER ADOPTING FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Senior Judge William B. Shubb on 1/3/14 as to Brett Lee Hartman ADOPTING IN FULL 67 Findings and Recommendations. 58 Motion to Vacate is DENIED; 66 Motion to Dismiss is GRANTED. The Court DECLINES to issue a certificate of appealability; and the Clerk of the Court is DIRECTED to close companion civil case no. 2:12-cv-2795 WBS-CMK. (Meuleman, A)
